before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"u2lt","text":"Perform all centrifugation steps at room temperature (15–25°C).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"519v1","text":"If Solution C1 has precipitated, heat at 60°C until precipitate dissolves.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"438h9","text":"For the isolation of microbial genomic DNA from all soil types","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eau3p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3f34s","text":"The DNeasy PowerSoil Kit comprises a novel and proprietary method for isolating genomic DNA from environmental samples using patented Inhibitor Removal Technology® (IRT). This kit is intended for use with environmental samples containing high humic acid content, including difficult soil types such as compost, sediment and manure. Other more common soil types have also been used successfully with this kit. The isolated DNA has a high level of purity, which allows for more successful PCR amplification of organisms from the sample. PCR analysis has been performed to detect a variety of organisms including bacteria (e.g., Bacillus subtilis, Bacillus anthracis), fungi (e.g., yeasts, molds), algae and actinomycetes (e.g., Streptomyces).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dtggm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4nlf4","text":"Protocol used successfully to detect target fish species sedDNA by Olajos et al., 2018; Nelson-Chorney et al., 2019; Thomson-Laing et al., 2020; Shiragaki et al., 2021; and Naro-Maciel et al., 2022 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
